src:
Жалгас Жумагулов сделал неожиданное заявление
02 Nov 2019, 10:28 by ИА Тотал Казахстан

Казахстанский боец может завершить карьеру.

Казахстанский боец смешанных единоборств, чемпион Fight Nights Global в наилегчайшем весе Жалгас Жумагулов заявил о том, что может завершить спортивную карьеру, если ему не удастся подписать контракт с UFC, сообщает Sports.kz.
«Я поставил точку, всем, все доказал, со всеми топами подрался, выиграл. Так что теперь дальше двигаемся. Больше, скорее всего, вы меня в Fight Nights Global не увидите. Если меня UFC не подпишет, наверное, скорее всего, я завершу карьеру. Такие у меня планы», - сказал Жалгас Жумагулов.
По его словам, после окончания карьеры он планирует работать тренером и передавать накопленный опыт молодому поколению казахстанских бойцов.
«Есть чем заниматься, буду тренировать молодежь, мотивировать. Построю свой зал, найду средства, думаю, мне помогут мои старшие братья. Хочу, чтобы у нас была правильная, воспитанная молодежь, чтобы уважали родителей, старших», — добавил Жалгас Жумагулов.
Напомним, Жако в Сочи защитил пояс чемпиона Fight Nights Global в наилегчайшем весе в бою против Али Багаутинова. Брат российского атлета Артур Багаутинов стал инициатором массовой потасовки после боя. Один из бизнесменов южной столицы, побывавший на турнире Fight Nights Global 95 в Сочи на титульном поединке Жако, подарил казахстанцу квартиру в Алматы.
text:
Elina Svitolina will play today against Belinda Bencic in the semifinal of the WTA Finals-2019 tennis tournament

02 Nov 2019, 10:45


The first “racket” of Ukraine and the eighth number of the world ranking Elina Svitolina today, November 2, will fight for the WTA Finals-2019, which takes place in Shenzhen, China, to reach the final of the 2019 Women's Championship Final Championship. The rival of the 25-year-old Ukrainian will be the seventh racket of the world 22-year-old Belinda Benchich from Switzerland. Their fight will begin at 12:30 Kiev time.

According to btu.org.ua, the rivals will play the fourth match between themselves today. Now the score of their confrontation is 2-1 in favor of the Swiss
2019. Toronto (Premier 5), hard third round, victory Svitolina - 6: 2 6: 4
2019. Dubai (Premier 5), hard, ½ finals, victory Bencic– 6: 2 3: 6 7: 6
2014. Charleston (Premier), ground third round, victory Bencic– 6: 7 6: 4 6: 1


The path of the rivals in the group stage of the WTA Finals-2019 tournament



Elina Svitolina

Karolina Plishkova (Czech Republic) - 7: 6 6: 4
Simone Halep (Romania) - 7: 5 6: 3
Sofia Keninov (USA) - 7: 5 7: 6

Belinda Bencic

Ashley Barty (Australia) - 7: 5 1: 6 2: 6
Petra Kvitova (Czech Republic) - 6: 3 1: 6 6: 4
Kiki Bertens (Netherlands) - 7: 5 1: 0 rejection


Tournament rivals history


Elina Svitolina - 9 wins / 2 losses. Elina performs for the third time at the WTA Final Championship. Last year, Ukraine became the champion of the tournament, winning all five matches.
Belinda Bencic - 2 wins / 1 loss. This year's Belinda debuted at the WTA Final Championship.


Bookmaker Quotes


Bookmakers prefer the Ukrainian tennis player in this match, assessing her chances of winning with a coefficient of 1.615. The success of her Swiss rival is estimated at 2.31.




We bring to your attention five facts about the performance of Elina Svitolina in Shenzhen

• Yesterday, November 1, in the final match in the Lilov group, the 25-year-old Ukrainian defeated the US debutant from the United States in exactly two hours: 7: 5, 7: 6 (12-10).
- Now Svitolina has won nine consecutive victories on the courts of WTA Finals. This is the longest win-win series since 2014, when the series of Serena Williams was interrupted (16 wins for the seasons 2009 and 2012-2014, in the 2010-2011 seasons the American did not take part in the Final Championship).
• In her quartet, Svitolina registered all three victories (over Karolina Plishkova, Simone Halep and Sofia Keninov) in two parties.
- For the first time since 2013, one of the tennis players managed to leave the group without losing a single set. Six years ago, Serena Williams in the group stage was similarly stronger than Angelica Kerber, Agnieszka Radwanska and Petra Kvitova.
• Elina guaranteed herself a ticket to the semifinals in Shenzhen following the results of two rounds in the Lilac group.
- For the last time, one of the tennis players managed to play in two semi-finals in a row - last year (Karolina Plishkova, 2017-2018). This season, the Czech Republic continued its series and will hold the third semi-final in a row at the WTA Finals.
• Recall that last season Elina Svitolina won the title at the Final Championship, beating Sloan Stevens from the USA.
- For the last time, the current champion managed to get to the WTA Finals semifinal next year - in 2016. The champion of the 2015 season Agnieszka Radwanska won the trophy by defeating Petra Kvitova, and a year later the Polish tennis player lost to Angelica Kerber in the semifinals.
• For reaching the second final in a row at the Final tournament, the Ukrainian will argue with Swiss Belinda Bencic (the score of personal meetings this year is 1-1, but only 1-2).
- Over the past 20 years, at least two times in a row in the finals played: Martina Hingis (finals-1999 / title-2000), Serena Williams (title-2001 / final-2002), Kim Clijsters (title-2002 / title-2003), Amelie Moresmo (title-2005 / final-2006), Justine Henin (title-2006 / title-2007), Venus Williams (title-2008 / final-2009), Serena Williams (title-2012 / title-2013 / title 2014 / title) .
- For the entire history of the competition (since 1972), his title at the Final Championship was defended by Chris Evert (1972-1973), Martina Navratilova (1978-1979; 1983-1986), Monica Seles (1990-1992), Steffi Graf (1995-1996 ), as well as the previously mentioned Kim Clijsters (2002-2003), Justine Henin (2006-2007) and Serena Williams (2012-2014).
We add that in the other semifinal of the current tennis tournament WTA Finals-2019 in Chinese Shenzhen today, November 2, at 14:00 Kiev time, the first and second “rackets” of the world will play - Ashley Barty (Australia) and Karolina Plishkova (Czech Republic), respectively.
